results.text_hl: ...@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ may prove beneficial in the treatment of @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ in children treated with second-generation antipsychotics.

results.text_hl: Importantly, several researches have shown @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ to be effective in managing @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ especially, with @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@AIWG@@@.

results.title: Position paper of the Italian Association of Medical Diabetologists (AMD), Italian Society of Diabetology (SID), and the Italian Study Group of Diabetes in pregnancy: Metformin use in pregnancy
results.text_hl: It is well known that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ improves maternal glycemic control, and it is associated with reduced gestational @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ in @SPECIES_9606 @@@women@@@ with @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus_Type_2 @DISEASE_MESH:D003924 @@@T2DM@@@.

results.title: Metformin versus glyburide in treatment and control of gestational diabetes mellitus: a systematic review with meta-analysis
results.text_hl: ,showed greater benefits of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ when compared to @CHEMICAL_Glyburide @CHEMICAL_MESH:D005905 @@@glyburide@@@, in terms of neonatal complications and @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ during pregnancy; the latter result was evident in our meta-analysis.

results.title: Efficacy and safety of hypoglycemic agents on gestational diabetes mellitus in women: A Bayesian network analysis of randomized controlled trials
results.text_hl: A total of 29 RCTs were included. @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ was estimated to lead to a slight improvement in total gestational @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ (WMD - 1.24 kg, 95% CI -2.38, -0.09), a risk of unmet treatment target in the sensitivity analysis (OR 34.50, 95% CI 1.18-791.37) than @GENE_INS @GENE_3630 @@@insulin@@@.

results.title: Metformin Prevents Key Mechanisms of Obesity-Related Complications in Visceral White Adipose Tissue of Obese Pregnant Mice
results.text_hl: The HFD + MF group gained significantly less weight (5.82 +- 2.23 g) than HFD dams, which corresponds to a reduced @<m>DISEASE_Weight_Gain</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D015430 @@@weight gain@@@ of 41.4% through @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ treatment during pregnancy.
